alert.note: Alert for Boone County Higher Elevations; Central and Southern Scott County; Conway; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Faulkner; Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Lower Elevations; Northern Scott County; Northwest Searcy County Higher Elevations; Northwest Yell County; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Van Buren County Higher Elevations; Western and Northern Logan County; White; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 24 at 2:14AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, eastern, north-central, and western Arkansas. * WHEN...Through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain and thunderstorms are expected to produce widespread rainfall amounts between two to four inches with locally higher amounts possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
